Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle with prominent volute-spines. The discus is decorated with a frieze of gladiatorial armour, including small deep buckler, helmets, knife, pair of greaves and shields. The lamp stands on a base-ring. Buff clay, covered in a streaky dark brown slip.
Curator's comments: See British Museum Parliamentary Returns 1892, p.55.
